image.altText: A mother sheep and two lambs in an open paddock

props.synopsis: The English Leicester makes no money on the farm's profit and loss sheet, but some farmers are passionate about the breed and its long, lustrous fleece.

title.children: Tasmanian farmers keep a rare sheep breed that makes no sense or cents

image.altText: Gerard Dezoete wears a suit and tie and dark sunglasses and looks at the camera with a serious expression

props.synopsis: Experienced tradesman Gerard Dezoete died after falling from a scissor lift on a construction site in central Launceston in 2020. The company contracting him has been cleared of all but one safety breach.

title.children: Man killed in fall from scissor lift had 'mental lapse': Magistrate

image.altText: Man stands at lectern with large crowd watching on

props.synopsis: With less than a week of the Tasmanian election campaign to go, state Labor has announced an expansion of its pledge to operate free GP clinics. But the challenge of staffing them remains.

title.children: More free GP clinics pledged as Tasmanian Labor officially launches campaign

image.altText: Photos of a prepolling centre for a state election.

props.synopsis: Tasmania leads the country in casting informal votes — here's how to make sure your ballot paper counts on July 19.

title.children: How to make your vote count at the Tasmanian election

image.altText: A tree burning.

props.synopsis: Sewage spills, polluted rivers, endangered plants and animals facing risk, fragmented landscapes – Tasmania has a long list of environmental problems. But neither major party appears willing to address it this election.

title.children: Environmental outlooks flagged, but issue sidelined in election campaign

image.altText: Woman in beanie and coat sits on park bench

props.synopsis: Amelia Bird would love to become a home-owner in Tasmania, but she isn't hopeful. Like many others, she is looking at what is being promised at this month's state election for people who want a place of their own.

title.children: These Tasmanians want to see housing as the number one priority this election

image.altText: Thumbnail image for Tasmania state election 2025 promise tracker article.

props.synopsis: As Tasmanians prepare for a July 19 vote, we keep track of each party's election promises on everything from health and housing, to the stadium.

title.children: What are Tasmanians being promised at their state election?

image.altText: hand puts a ballot into a voting ballot box

props.synopsis: Where can I vote? Can I take a selfie while doing it? Who are the candidates? All your questions about the Tasmanian state election answered.

title.children: Your questions about Tasmania's election answered

image.altText: Wind turbines black and white.

props.synopsis: International energy companies are reconsidering their investments in Australian offshore wind projects as the Trump administration's disruption of the industry causes global uncertainty.

title.children: Energy giant drops offshore wind project amid global 'headwinds'

image.altText: Marla Maples.

props.synopsis: Marla Maples reveals the role she played in bringing the US President and Robert F Kennedy Jr into a powerful political alliance.

title.children: She was married to Trump, now she's helping rewrite America's health system

image.altText: Two bitcoin tokens and a price chart behind them

props.synopsis: The original cryptocurrency has moved to the mainstream, with institutional investors and exchange traded funds helping build momentum. But some analysts remain sceptical about bitcoin's trajectory.

title.children: Bitcoin surges to a fresh high but some warn 'it could get very ugly'

image.altText: Man with dark hair and a beard sits at a table and looks at his ipad.

props.synopsis: Jarod Graham says he is owed nearly $10,000 in unpaid superannuation from his former boss. He's not the only one.

title.children: Young workers falling victim to 'toxic work culture' and exploitation in huge numbers

image.altText: A brain on a tray in a lab.

props.synopsis: Australian scientists find the first evidence of an unusual pattern of brain scarring only seen in people repeatedly exposed to blast waves.

title.children: Brain injury of Australian soldier matches that of dead US Navy SEALS

image.altText: James Paterson addresses the media at parliament house

props.synopsis: A Coalition senator says the government is delusional to think it can reach its 1.2 million new homes target by 2029. Follow live.

title.children: Paterson says government 'delusional' about new homes target

image.altText: A man looks at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis: A rally on Wall Street has sent Australian stocks higher, while the Reserve Bank proposes an end to credit and debit card surcharges, which would save consumers and businesses $1.2 billion a year. Follow the latest updates in our live blog.

title.children: ASX rises after Wall Street gains on trade talks

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Top and bottom movers at open
BREAKING: RBA proposes end to credit and debit card surcharges

image.altText: Mitchell Starc smiles with captain Pat Cummins after winning the third Test against West Indies.

props.synopsis: Scott Boland takes the first hat-trick by an Australian man in 15 years as Mitchell Starc's career-best, record-breaking six-wicket haul sends Australia sprinting towards victory in the third Test in Jamaica.

title.children: Six-wicket Starc praises Boland for hat-trick in chaotic Jamaica victory

image.altText: A woman surrounded by other pro-independence demonstrators holds up a Kanak flag behind her back.

props.synopsis: Observers say regardless of the enthusiasm of French President Emmanuel Macron, the deal faces a long and uncertain path before it can take effect. So, how did it get to this point, and what needs to happen for it to take effect?

title.children: France has agreed to create a new 'state' near Australia. What does it mean?

image.altText: A piece of a broken plane sits surrounded by trees and emergency workers

props.synopsis: Scrutiny is intensifying over the fuel switch locks at the centre of an investigation into last month's deadly Air India crash, which killed 260 people.

title.children: India orders airlines to check fuel switches on Boeing jets after deadly crash

image.altText: Paul Kabai and Pabai Pabai

props.synopsis: In a landmark case, a judge will today decide whether Australia needs to make deeper emissions cuts to protect its low-lying islands. Two Torres Strait Islanders have sued the federal government for failing to protect their homes from the impacts of climate change.

title.children: 'Saving my people': Four-year landmark climate battle to be decided today

image.altText: a couple sitting on a couch

props.synopsis: Some in the industry say the case highlights the need for more to be done to stop unlicensed contractors promising to complete small jobs.

title.children: A handyman was paid $8k for work he never did. Turns out he's in jail

image.altText: GettyImages-2224341657

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says the Club World Cup trophy remains in the Oval Office despite Chelsea winning the competition over the weekend.

title.children: Trump says he has real Club World Cup trophy and Chelsea given replica

image.altText: A dark-lit room with colourfu women's and kid's clothes on a rack, domestic violence pamphlets displayed on back wall.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's family and domestic violence sector is at a "crisis point" with one service turning away up to 200 women every month, including those assessed as being at "serious risk" of harm or death.

title.children: 'We are at crisis point': NT's domestic violence sector turning hundreds away

image.altText: Three men, including two wearing vests that say security, walk through the doors to a shopping centre at night.

props.synopsis: Police say an alleged random stabbing outside a shopping centre in Melbourne's inner north-west involved mental health issues, not terrorism.

title.children: Moonee Ponds shopping centre stabbing not terrorism, police say

image.altText: a long stretch of blue hallway in a sterile, brightly lit warehouse

props.synopsis: Documents show Greater Western Water is assessing 19 data centre applications requesting to use a total of 20 gigalitres of water annually — the same amount 330,000 Melburnians used in the last financial year.

title.children: Data centres in Melbourne's west could threaten water supply

image.altText: A photo of Sesame Street character Elmo holding a card with a heart on it

props.synopsis: The account has more than 650,000 followers and is a reliable stream of wholesome content on a platform where inflammatory rhetoric and abusive messages thrive.

title.children: Hacker uses Elmo's X account to post antisemitic rant and demand release of Epstein files

image.altText: Large mounds of brown seaweed alongside pylons on a beach.

props.synopsis: The opening of Marion Bay's new $3.8 million boat ramp has been marred by a host of safety complaints, with key groups now refusing to use it.

title.children: The new $3.8m boat ramp that fishers and Sea Rescue refuse to use

image.altText: A man in a blue jumper and a a woman in a white and grey jumper, holding a red folder, standing in front of a grave.

props.synopsis: More than 160 years before Erin Patterson's mushroom murder trial, four SA children died after eating poisonous mushrooms.

title.children: Mushroom trial raises scars of 1861 poisoning that killed four children

image.altText: A police car parked out the front of a house cut off with police tape.

props.synopsis: The death of a 57-year-old man at Warana has sparked an investigation as police call for information from the public.

title.children: Police investigate after man dies at Sunshine Coast home

image.altText: A close up of a mother holding her son who has his arms wrapped around her.

props.synopsis: A survey of nearly 400 women around Australia found a delay in diagnosing birth injuries is leading to more severe mental health issues.

title.children: A delay in diagnosing childbirth injuries is affecting women's mental health, survey finds

image.altText: A large sandstone block sits on red carpet with two iron rings imbedded in it

props.synopsis: Arnaud Harixcalde Logan appeared in a Scottish court charged with "malicious mischief" after allegedly damaging the glass case which held the stone.

title.children: Kilt-clad man from Sydney arrested after allegedly smashing Stone of Scone case

image.altText: Tony Burke wearing a dark blazer and blue tie, emotionless while standing and wearing dark-framed glasses

props.synopsis: Home Affairs Minister Tony Burke says he believes Australia's antisemitic envoy when she says she had no knowledge of donations made by a trust linked to her husband to right wing lobby group Advance.

title.children: 'Believe her': Burke backs Segal's denial of knowledge about Advance donation

image.altText: Man donates plasma

props.synopsis: Thousands of members of the LGBTQI+ and sex worker communities can now donate plasma in Australia without having to wait three months from the last time they had sex.

title.children: 625,000 more Aussies can now donate plasma. Here's why the rules changed

image.altText: Mina Price, aged 10m holding a helmet.

props.synopsis: Aged just 10, Mina Langham is part of a growing number of females participating in motorsport in recent years.

title.children: More girls are go-karting and have peers 'spinning off the track'

image.altText: A man in a chair after a fire

props.synopsis: Firefighters were met with heavy smoke and flames at the front of the building, with occupants trapped inside, officials said.

title.children: At least nine dead after fire at Massachusetts assisted living facility

image.altText: A group of England cricketers run joyfully towards the bowler (off camera) as an Indian batsman stands dejected at the crease.

props.synopsis: England beats India in the final session of a thrilling day five at Lord's to take a 2-1 lead in the Anderson-Tendulkar trophy, as the tourists fall just short of a famous victory.

title.children: England holds nerve to sink India in Lord's Test thriller
